kpiInfo.definition: Meausures the Percentage of Defect created and linked to stories in a sprint against the number of stories in the same sprint

operands: No. of defects tagged to all stories closed in a sprint
Total no. of stories closed in the sprint

kpiInfo.definition: Measures the percentage of tickets that passed QA with no return transition or any tagging to a specific configured status and no linkage of a defect

operands: No. of issues closed in a sprint with no return transition or any defects tagged
Total no. of issues closed in the sprint

kpiInfo.definition: Measures the total number of defect created and linked to stories in a sprint against the size of stories in the same sprint

operands: No. of defects tagged to all stories closed in a sprint
Total size of stories closed in the sprint

kpiInfo.definition: Measures the percentage of defects leaked from the QA (sprint) testing stage to the UAT/Production stage

operands: No. of  valid defects reported at a stage (e.g. UAT)
Total no. of defects reported in the current stage and previous stage (UAT & QA)

kpiInfo.definition: Measure of percentage of defects closed against the total count tagged to the iteration

operands: No. of defects in the iteration that are fixed
Total no. of defects in an iteration

kpiInfo.definition: Measures the percentage of defect rejection  based on status or resolution of the defect

operands: No. of defects rejected in a sprint
Total no. of defects Closed in a sprint

kpiInfo.definition: Measures the number of defects grouped by priority in an iteration

formula.lhs: Defect Count By Priority=No. of defects linked to stories grouped by priority

kpiInfo.definition: Measures the number of defects grouped by root cause in an iteration

formula.lhs: Defect Count By RCA = No. of defects linked to stories grouped by Root Cause

kpiInfo.definition: Comparative view of number of defects created and number of defects closed in an iteration.
Measures the progress of automation of regression test cases (the test cases which are marked as part of regression suite.

operands: No. of regression test cases automated
Total no. of regression test cases

kpiInfo.definition: Measures the progress of automation of test cases created within the Sprint

operands: No. of in-sprint test cases automated
Total no. of in-sprint test cases created

kpiInfo.definition: Measure  of the amount of code that is covered by unit tests.

formula.lhs: The calculation is done directly in Sonarqube

kpiInfo.definition: Measures the count of issues that voilates the set of coding rules, defined through the associated Quality profile for each programming language in the project.

formula.lhs: Issues are categorized in 3 types: Bug, Vulnerability and Code Smells

kpiInfo.definition: Time Estimate required to fix all Issues/code smells reported in Sonar code analysis.

formula.lhs: It is calculated as effort to fix all Code Smells. The effort is calculated in minutes and converted to days by assuming 1 Day =8 Hours.

kpiInfo.definition: Sonar Code Quality is graded based on the static and dynamic code analysis procedure built in Sonarqube that analyses code from multiple perspectives.

details.value: Code Quality in Sonarqube is shown as Grades (A to E).
A is the highest (best) and,
E is the least

kpiInfo.definition: Measures the percentage of test cases that have been executed & and the test that have passed.
Number of Issues assigned in a sprint.
Measures the percentage of work completed at the end of a iteration in comparison to the initial scope and the final scope

operands: No. of issues or Size of issues completed
No. of issues or Size of issues committed

kpiInfo.definition: Measures the percentage the iteration velocity against the average velocity of last 3 iteration.

operands: sprint velocity of the targeted sprint.
average sprint velocity of previous 3 sprints

kpiInfo.definition: Measures the rate of delivery across Sprints. Average velocity is calculated for the latest 5 sprints
Measure the outcome of sprint as planned estimate vs actual estimate

details.value: Estimated Hours: It explains the total hours required to complete Sprint backlog. The capacity is defined in KnowHOW
Logged Work: The amount of time team has logged within a Sprint. It is derived as sum of all logged work against issues tagged to a Sprint in Jira

kpiInfo.definition: Measures the time taken for a builds of a given Job.
Measures the number of releases done in a month

formula.lhs: Release Frequency for a month = Number of fix versions in JIRA for a project that have a release date falling in a particular month

kpiInfo.definition: Cost of delay (CoD) is a indicator of the economic value of completing a feature sooner as opposed to later.

formula.lhs: COD for a Epic or a Feature  =  User-Business Value + Time Criticality + Risk Reduction and/or Opportunity Enablement.

details.value: KPI for tracking moral of team members

kpiInfo.definition: PI predictability is calculated by the sum of the actual value achieved against the planned value at the beginning of the PI
Scope churn explains the change in the scope of the sprint since the start of the iteration

operands: Count of Stories added + Count of Stories removed
Count of Stories in Initial Commitment at the time of Sprint start

kpiInfo.definition: Number of Issues assigned in a sprint.
Measures the rate of delivery across Sprints. Average velocity is calculated for the latest 5 sprints
Measures the percentage of work completed at the end of a iteration in comparison to the initial scope and the final scope

operands: No. of issues or Size of issues completed
No. of issues or Size of issues committed

kpiInfo.definition: Cost of delay (CoD) is a indicator of the economic value of completing a feature sooner as opposed to later.

formula.lhs: COD for a Epic or a Feature  =  User-Business Value + Time Criticality + Risk Reduction and/or Opportunity Enablement.

kpiInfo.definition: PI predictability is calculated by the sum of the actual value achieved against the planned value at the beginning of the PI

details.value: Planned capacity is the development team's available time.
Source of this is KnowHOW

kpiInfo.definition: Iteration commitment shows in terms of issue count and story points the Initial commitment (issues tagged when the iteration starts), Scope added and Scope removed.

details.value: Overall commitment= Initial Commitment + Scope added - Scope removed

kpiInfo.definition: It shows count of the issues having a due date which are planned to be completed until today and how many of these issues have actually been completed. It also depicts the delay in completing the planned issues in terms of days.
It gives a comparative view between the planned completion and actual completion from a development point of view. In addition, user can see the delay (in days) in dev completed issues
Remaining work in the iteration in terms count of issues & sum of story estimates. Sum of remaining hours required to complete pending work.

details.value: In the list of Issues you can see potential delay & completion date for each issues.
In addition, it also shows the potential delay because of all pending stories. Potential delay and predicted completion date can be seen for each issue as well.

kpiInfo.definition: It shows count of the issues which do not have a due date. It also shows the completed count amongst the unplanned issues.

It gives intelligence to users about how many issues can be completed on a particular day of an iteration. An issue is included as a possible closure based on the calculation of Predicted completion date.
It gives intelligence to the team about number of issues that could potentially not get completed during the iteration. Issues which have a Predicted Completion date > Sprint end date are considered.

Iteration Burnup KPI shows the cumulative actual progress against the overall scope of the iteration on a daily basis. For teams putting due dates at the beginning of iteration, the graph additionally shows the actual progress in comparison to the planning done and also predicts the probable progress for the remaining days of the iteration.

details.value: Wastage = Blocked time + Wait time
Blocked time - Total time when any issue is in a status like Blocked as defined in the configuration or if any issue is flagged.
Wait time : Total time when any issue is in status similar to Ready for testing, ready for deployment as defined in the configuration etc.

kpiInfo.definition: Percentage of tickets that passed QA with no return transition or any tagging to a specific configured status and no linkage of a defect.

It showcases the count of defect linked to stories and count that are not linked to any story. The defect injection rate and defect density are shown to give a wholistic view of quality of ongoing iteration

details.value: *Any defect created during the iteration duration but is not added to the iteration is not considered

kpiInfo.definition: It shows the breakup of all defects within an iteration by status. User can view the total defects in the iteration as well as the defects created after iteration start.
It shows the breakup of all defects within an iteration by root cause identified.
It shows the breakup of all defects within an iteration by priority. User can view the total defects in the iteration as well as the defects created after iteration start.
It shows the count of issues which do not have estimates and count of In progress issues without any work logs.
Estimate vs Actual gives a comparative view of the sum of estimated hours of all issues in an iteration as against the total time spent on these issues.
Measures the efficiency of the code review process in a team
Comparative view of number of check-ins and number of merge request raised for a period.

kpis.kpiName: Ticket Open vs Closed rate by type

kpiDetail.kpiName: Ticket Open vs Closed rate by type

kpiInfo.definition: Ticket open vs closed rate by type gives a comparison of new tickets getting raised vs number of tickets getting closed grouped by issue type during a defined period.

kpis.kpiName: Ticket Open vs Closed rate by Priority

kpiDetail.kpiName: Ticket Open vs Closed rate by Priority

kpiInfo.definition: Ticket open vs closed rate by priority gives a comparison of new tickets getting raised vs number of tickets getting closed grouped by priority during a defined period.

kpis.kpiName: Net Open Ticket Count by Priority

kpiDetail.kpiName: Net Open Ticket Count by Priority

kpiInfo.definition: Measures of  overall open tickets during a defined period grouped by priority. It considers the gross open and closed count during the period.

kpis.kpiName: Net Open Ticket Count By RCA

kpiDetail.kpiName: Net Open Ticket Count By RCA

kpiInfo.definition: Measures of  overall open tickets during a defined period grouped by RCA. It considers the gross open and closed count during the period.
Measures the overall open tickets during a defined period grouped by Status. It considers the gross open and closed count during the period.
Measure of all the open tickets based on their ageing, grouped by priority
Measures progress of automation of regression test cases

operands: No. of regression test cases automated
Total no. of regression test cases

kpiInfo.definition: Measures the percentage of test cases that have been executed & the percentage that have passed in a defined duration.
Ticket velocity measures the size of tickets (in story points) completed in a defined duration
Team Capacity is sum of capacity of all team member measured in hours during a defined period. This is defined/managed by project administration section

kpiLinkDetail.text: Refer the capacity management guide at

kpiInfo.definition: Measures the time taken for a build of a given Job.
Measures  Total time between a request was made and  all work on this item is completed and the request was delivered .

formula.lhs: It is calculated as the sum following

details.value: Open to Triage: Time taken from ticket creation to it being refined & prioritized for development.
Triage to Complete: Time taken from start of work on a ticket to it being completed by team.
Complete to Live: Time taken between ticket completion to it going live.

kpiInfo.definition: Measures the number of releases done in a month

formula.rhs: Number of fix versions in JIRA for a project that have a release date falling in a particular month

formula.lhs: COD for a Epic or a Feature  =  User-Business Value + Time Criticality + Risk Reduction and/or Opportunity Enablement.

kpiInfo.definition: Cost of delay (CoD) is a indicator of the economic value of completing a feature sooner as opposed to later.

formula.lhs: COD for a Epic or a Feature  =  User-Business Value + Time Criticality + Risk Reduction and/or Opportunity Enablement.

kpiInfo.definition: Measures of the the count of check in in repo for the defined period.
It shows the breakup of all defects tagged to a release based on Status. The breakup is shown in terms of count & percentage.

It shows the cumulative daily actual progress of the release against the overall scope. It also shows additionally the scope added or removed during the release w.r.t Dev/Qa completion date and Dev/Qa completion status for the Release tagged issues
It shows the breakup of all defects tagged to a release based on RCA. The breakup is shown in terms of count & percentage.
It shows the breakup of all defects tagged to a release based on Assignee. The breakup is shown in terms of count & percentage.
It shows the breakup of all defects tagged to a release based on Priority. The breakup is shown in terms of count & percentage.
It shows the breakup by status of issues tagged to a release. The breakup is based on both issue count and story points
It depicts the progress of each epic in a release in terms of total count and %age completion.
It gives a breakup of escaped defects by testing phase
LEAD TIME FOR CHANGE measures the velocity of software delivery.

details.value: LEAD TIME FOR CHANGE Captures the time between a code change to commit and deployed to production.

kpiInfo.definition: Mean time to recover will be based on the Production incident tickets raised during a certain period of time.

details.value: For all the production incident tickets raised during a time period, the time between created date and closed date of the incident ticket will be calculated.
The average of all such tickets will be shown.

kpiInfo.definition: Measures the proportion of builds that have failed over a given period of time

operands: Total number of failed Builds
Total number of Builds

kpiInfo.definition: Measures how often code is deployed to production in a period

details.value: Ready Backlog: No. of issues which are refined in the backlog. This is identified through a status configured in KnowHOW.
Backlog Strength: Total size of 'Refined' issues in the backlog / Average velocity of last 5 sprints. It is calculated in terms of no. of sprints. Recommended strength is 2 sprints.
Readiness cycle time: Average time taken for Product Backlog items (PBIs) to be refined.

kpiInfo.definition: Lead Time is the time from the moment when the request was made by a client and placed on a board to when all work on this item is completed and the request was delivered to the client
The percentage of time spent in work states vs wait states across the lifecycle of an issue
It groups all the open production defects based on their ageing in the backlog.

formula.lhs: Testcases without story link = Total non-regression test cases without story link
Defect Count Without Story Link= Total defects without Story link

kpiInfo.definition: Iteration readiness depicts the state of future iterations w.r.t the quality of refined Backlog
It shows number of defects reopened in a given span of time in comparison to the total closed defects. For all the reopened defects, the average time to reopen is also available.
It depicts the progress of each epic in terms of total count and %age completion.
It measures the percentage of stories rejected during refinement as compared to the overall stories discussed in a week.
Flow Distribution evaluates the amount of each kind of work (issue types) which are open in the backlog over a period of time.
Flow load indicates how many items are currently in the backlog. This KPI emphasizes on limiting work in progress to enabling a fast flow of issues
Total count of issues in the Backlog with a breakup by Status.
Total count of issues in the backlog with a breakup by issue type.
Total count of issues in the backlog with a breakup by defect type.
